website_summaries.verdict: Starrett is one of the industry leaders in dial calipers, but that kind of precision and quality construction costs a lot.
pros: No trouble getting the caliper to return to zero
Easy to use and stays in place
Solid construction that can withstand heavy use
cons: This is an expensive caliper, and it may not be worth the investment unless you plan on using it a lot

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made gear mechanism
customer_reviews.text: These calipers appear heavy duty and precision on the outside and they are. But, on the inside they are very cheaply made. Mine started to read differently every time I closed they so I took it apart to clean and repair it. the gears and mechanisms were flimsy and cheap. I looked on YouTube and all of the repair videos had way better insides than these. I also found out this model is made in China. Seems to be another case of corporate greed. It is a shame because the slider and main part of the caliper is so high quality, its a waste of good materials.
customer_reviews.author: Cats meow

customer_reviews.title: Made in China, not USA.
customer_reviews.text: Shame on me, I should’ve read a little more. This item is not made by Sterritt, it is made by Chinese manufacture,For Sterritt. The outward appearance seems good, but it has a tendency to lose zero.I would not recommend getting this caliper, unless it’s all you can afford.
customer_reviews.author: T MICHAEL

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: not old Starrett quality will not stay zerord constantly having to reset
customer_reviews.author: janna russell

customer_reviews.title: Made in China
customer_reviews.text: Made in China. I am surprised starrett put their name on these. They are not in the same ballpark in quality of normal American made starrett calipers. These are comparable to $20-$30 calipers at your local tool store.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Cutright

customer_reviews.title: More Chinese junk!
customer_reviews.text: Another made in China piece of junk! If I knew Starrett had farmed out to China, I would have never purchased it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: If you thought you were buying American
customer_reviews.text: The caliper works fine. I thought I was buying an American made product because the description did not say Global or International Model. When the calipers arrived I saw that it was made in China. If I would have known that I would have held out and bought a American made product. Can't say anything bad so far but I am disappointed that so many products are being farmed out to our enemies. I could have bought a Chinese caliper at Harbor Freight for around $20 if that is what I wanted.
customer_reviews.author: M.B.

customer_reviews.title: Nice mechanical caliper
customer_reviews.text: I've only had this caliper for 6 months or so, and I am not a machinist. However, it seems like these are far better than the last 2 electronic calipers I got from the local big box store. Besides eating batteries, the cheaply made electronic calipers did not consistently go back to zero. This caliper consistently resets to zero, and the action feels smooth and repeatable. Again, I am not a machinist, so I can't attest to their accuracy to 0.00001", but for meticulous woodworking and general all around measurements where you need a caliper, these appear to be reliable, repeatable, and DO NOT require batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: Heavy Chinese Junk
customer_reviews.text: I knew when I took it out of the box something was wrong. We use our tools all day long. the first set I got 15 years ago somebody in the shop broke the face, still worked. so I thought id just order another pair. don't do it. What is Starrett thinking.
customer_reviews.author: James Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Not accurate buy something else
customer_reviews.text: Cheap Chinese junk. They just don't compare to the starrett 120's. The set I got wont stay zeroed. They will only read within plus or minus .010'' which unacceptable for a tool with the starrett name in it. You could measure the same thing 10 times in a row and wouldn't get the same measurement twice. If you want starrett spend the money and get the 120's if you want imported get the fowler calipers for half the price.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Findlay

customer_reviews.title: Made in China?? Really?
customer_reviews.text: Good quality a little sticky till broke now work very well. I did not like the fact that after I got these I found out the box and the case said made in China Starretts are made in the USA not China had inof known I would of never bought them but we will see how they do I’ve had them almost a month so far so good
customer_reviews.author: Michael Crane

customer_reviews.title: junk do not buy
customer_reviews.text: Used the tool on an occasional basis. Didnt even make it a year.
customer_reviews.author: JAMISON S.

customer_reviews.title: These make sure my ammo is to spec.
customer_reviews.text: I know people talk negatively about these because they're built overseas, but for what I use them for, which is reloading, they're great. If I was a machinist I might look at it differently, but the bottom line is, they work perfectly for me.
customer_reviews.author: Jason F.

customer_reviews.title: Simple, precise dial calipers
customer_reviews.text: I'm not much of a machinist so this is as precise of an instrument as I ever need. Much better than the harbor freight digital calipers I had, I can consistently repeat a measurement on my cat's hair (~.00175") which the previously mentioned digital calipers were not accurate enough to repeat.
customer_reviews.author: ArcherSeven

customer_reviews.title: Not made in Mass
customer_reviews.text: You trying to get me laughed outta the union hall?
customer_reviews.author: nick dolphin

customer_reviews.title: Looks and feels like Starrett tools should
customer_reviews.text: Looks and feels like Starrett tools should. Seems to be right on the mark in accuracy. The plastic box is a little cheap, but it's padded top and bottom and should do ok protecting the tool. I hate that it's made in China though.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: Nice heavy duty dial caliper
customer_reviews.text: Nice heavy duty dial caliper. I had a inexpensive one and misplaced it, so I decided to get a better unit. I do a lot of reloading and exact measurement is critical in long distance shooting. Very glad I chose the Starrett.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great calipers!
customer_reviews.text: As good of quality as you would expect for starrett. Nothing sets them apart from mittytoyo or B&S. They are simply good quality but aren’t super smooth. I own mitutoyo and starrett calipers and the mitutoyo is smoother but starretts product guarantee is great.
customer_reviews.author: Landon Miller

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for general machining tolerances
customer_reviews.text: These calipers are absolutely great for the price. I got the uncertified ones, but checked their calibration before use and had no issues with accuracy. These are my most used measuring tool in the shop and they’ve held up great. The slide and dial are nice and crisp feeling and easy to read.
customer_reviews.author: AR_DiMaRcS

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Despite being Chinese manufacture,these calipers are very smooth in operation,well finished and quite accurate .
customer_reviews.author: Sam S.

customer_reviews.title: Feel good
customer_reviews.text: Super quality for such a low price! Super tight feel
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Sibila

customer_reviews.title: showing it is better constructed. You can't go wrong with Starrett
customer_reviews.text: Just what you would expect from Starrett. Feels solid and hefty in your hands. I also bought a second caliper of a different brand for a lot less because I needed two and I wanted to compare. The less expensive one is adequate but the Starrett is obviously more solidly constructed. It is a little heavier, has a few more screws, etc. showing it is better constructed. You can't go wrong with Starrett.
customer_reviews.author: Clark Snyder

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy
customer_reviews.text: Junk!! There way out of an adjustment. Do not buy
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Sheber

customer_reviews.title: Starrett - one of the best
customer_reviews.text: Having a precisely manufactured tool is invaluable in the shop. It is my ultimate reference for measuring.

customer_reviews.title: Far exceeded my expectations. Accurate, easy to read, very precise measurements.
customer_reviews.text: I like everything about it. It is a costly item, but the precise measurement it provides gives me results I know are reliable.
customer_reviews.author: thomas brownleemeatloaf

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: This may be off by +/- 0.002 inches, but it has a very nice sturdy feel to it, and does everything I need it to.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: NOT MADE IN USA
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed to see this Starrett is not made in USA.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I use them daily at work.
customer_reviews.text: Love them wish the case was a better quality though.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly samaras

customer_reviews.title: Starrett Quality and deserved Reputation.
customer_reviews.text: I love my Starrett. Quality built and a brand with a deep reputation.
customer_reviews.author: Shaunagain

customer_reviews.title: best value for the money
customer_reviews.text: I have used many analog calipers and this model for the money works the next because it has the right weight and feel when you measure something with it larger dial is better too
customer_reviews.author: RGagnon

customer_reviews.title: My main workhorse caliper
customer_reviews.text: I use these a hundred or so times per day at my job. They have a smooth action which is very important to me. They have never locked or jumped teeth.
customer_reviews.author: Renee

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Does the job. It's hard to beat the Starrett brand.
customer_reviews.author: Larry W. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Nice set!
customer_reviews.text: What can I say, they're Starrett! Great product, no issues and functions flawlessly!
customer_reviews.author: Antony Miller

customer_reviews.title: D Hey CB
customer_reviews.text: The name says it all.they are perfect And I think they arrived in one day. I couldn’t be happier!!
customer_reviews.author: Todd

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic product. Incredibly precise for calipers, compared to other brands.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Been using Starrett products since '78
customer_reviews.text: Starrett is a great example of getting what you pay for
customer_reviews.author: Michael Witcher

customer_reviews.title: Very well built and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Last Starrett I owned I bought in 1988 and lasted with proper care till 2018.
customer_reviews.author: Eugene

customer_reviews.title: The surface finishes are very nice, and all the edges are soft
customer_reviews.text: It is indeed made in China, but it doesn't in any way feel cheap. The surface finishes are very nice, and all the edges are soft. This is a precision instrument, manufactured to high standards, as you would expect from the Starrett name. I have some Starrett tools that were made back in the 1920s; this one would not feel out of place among them. It's really good, and absolutely amazing for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very Satisfied
customer_reviews.text: I received this yesterday. Excellent caliper. I manage the metrology dept. for a machine shop. The first thing I did was to certify the jaws, I.D. nibs and depth stem with gage blocks and set rings. It measures spot on, and repeats. They have a nice weight and the open /close action is very smooth. They seem to be fairly rugged, and a good value for the price.
customer_reviews.author: joe wagner

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nice smooth action on the dial got here in good time I'm very happy with my order.
customer_reviews.author: David Kalskett

customer_reviews.title: Highly disappointed that Starret would allow their name on it
customer_reviews.text: Made in China Junk. Out of the box they are off when i put them on a standard. Might be ok for a hobby , but i wouldn't trust them for precision machine work. Highly disappointed that Starret would allow their name on it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: good product
customer_reviews.text: These calipers are pretty good quality even though NOT made in USA. That's the only reason I gave 4 stars because I wasn't expecting china made starett calipers but they are very accurate every time. the shop I work in also checked and calibrated them and passed
customer_reviews.author: staff

customer_reviews.title: Great calipers.
customer_reviews.text: This is my first time using an instrument like this. It was purchased in conjunction with a micrometer for a vocational machinist program. So far about 6 weeks in they work great. They have a nice weight to them not to heavy though can be very easily articulated with one hand and they feel solid. That being said if I lost them or they got stolen or w.e I would definitely purchase these again.
customer_reviews.author: marcus j aguirre

customer_reviews.title: Dial caliper review
customer_reviews.text: I needed these calipers to do measurements on my trombone mouthpieces. Starrett is simply the BEST in these type of tools! And the price was excellent.
customer_reviews.author: George Felder III

customer_reviews.title: Good mid-level calipers
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately I hadn't realized that this product is one of Starretts global series until after I purchased it. Although it is not made in the USA it still seems to be a good and accurate caliper. In it's price range, it's hard to beat but just not quite as smoothly operating as Starretts US made calipers that come at a little higher price point.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Got it for Christmas. Have used it. It works great. Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: JOW2

customer_reviews.title: Good price. Good quality.
customer_reviews.text: I was looking at all the the options and found this one to be a good price considering the name. I use it everyday as well as check it with a standard. Easy use and accurate readings. Sturdy. I work in a part 145 helicopter overhaul/service center so it's necessary to have better than the $12 calipers. I'd like to note. Made in China. Sad
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Reaper

customer_reviews.title: Made in China
customer_reviews.text: Surpised to find a Starrett tool that was Chinese made.
customer_reviews.author: David B

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: This not the quality a product, I will be returning it Monday it will not hold a zero.
customer_reviews.author: James Marshall

customer_reviews.title: They are the best
customer_reviews.text: I had one years ago and missed it terribly, but I just never had the need until recently. They are great.
customer_reviews.author: Flicker

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: It is a starrett! I don't have anything from starrett that is not top notch!
customer_reviews.author: todd morris

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality, near micrometer precision
customer_reviews.text: This caliper is exactly what you would expect from Starrett. Excellent quality, near micrometer precision. I am a satisfied customer.
customer_reviews.author: John Lewis Ebert

customer_reviews.title: not bad for the price
customer_reviews.text: not bad for the price. A little loose, will slip open on its own if you're not careful with it.
customer_reviews.author: David Menard

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Not made in the USA. But still a quality Starrett tool
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased
customer_reviews.text: High quality, what you would expect from starrett. Very pleased with it how it has performed so far. I am in maintenance so I don't use it every day, but it has worked flawlessly when it was needed.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan U Notsch

product_meta.title: Starrett Dial Caliper Measuring Tool 3202-6, Hardened Stainless Steel Metal, 6 Inch Range, 0.001" Graduation, Measure Inside Outside Dimensions and Depth, Carry Case Included, White
product_meta.description: Color:WhiteThe Starrett Dial Calipers provide quick, accurate measurements of outside dimensions, inside dimensions and depth. The dial caliper is the most versatile precision hand tool on the market and has been the first choice of metal working professionals for decades. This series features 0-6" range and 0.001" graduation in fitted case.
feature_bullets: Provides quick, accurate measurement of O.D, I.D and depth
Lock screws for sliding jaw and dial bezel
Hardened stainless steel bar, measuring surfaces, rack, gears and depth rod

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars198 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
